The rate of adoption of these technological advancements in the shipping industry can vary by company, as it depends on various factors such as cost, availability of infrastructure, regulatory requirements and competition in the market. 

However, there have been some encouraging signs of progress towards adopting sustainable and innovative technologies across the shipping sector. For example, major companies in the industry, including those operating on the Elbe River, are increasingly setting targets for reducing emissions and investing in new technologies to achieve these targets.

Moreover, some governments are implementing policies and regulations that encourage or require adoption of cleaner technologies and practices in the shipping industry. For example, the International Maritime Organization (IMO) has set an ambitious goal to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from shipping by at least 50% by 2050 compared to 2008 levels.

Overall, while the rate of adoption may vary, there is growing recognition across the industry that innovative and sustainable technologies are necessary for long-term viability and the protection of the environment, which could also benefit businesses and the economy in the long run.
